# Shellfish Water Classification Program

## Title and Reference Information

* **Title (French/English)**: Programme de classification des eaux coquillières / Shellfish Water Classification Program
* **Reference Number**: cb-4729-2025298
* **Amendment Number**: 1
* **Purchase Order Number**: 5000069767

## Program Overview

The Canadian Shellfish Sanitation Program (CSSP) monitors the harvesting of shellfish in Canada to protect public health. This program requires the annual review of shellfish area conditions and water quality sampling. 

## Project Requirements

* Conduct bacteriological water quality studies in shellfish areas and aquaculture sites in Gaspésie and the Magdalen Islands.
* Sample seawater and perform bacteriological analyzes in a laboratory accredited according to ISO/IEC 17025.
* Measure physical and meteorological factors during sampling rounds.
* Enter data via the “Regional Shellfish Sanitation Information Platform” (PRISM).
* Provide weekly and monthly sampling plans.
* Maintain a field notebook and microbiological sample register.
